item.title: To the dead
item.description:
To, the dead
The flavoured peppermint you saved for me
still stinks my mouth. The laced bracelet
also remain hanged tighted to the rose
canvas you painted, just to keep our room
lively and vibrant. There are some crystal
pebbles lying in the backyard which were
left from the ones bought to decorate your
grave bright. I didn’t change the doormat
cause it has your footsteps stored.
The sunflower plants in the garden too are
dying for I want no water to drain them
ranting my sorrows, also there is less of
sunlight strength watching them, like you
did. The books in the shelf are weekly
cleaned, inside your vinyl vase I found your
secret letters to me, but I never opened it
thinking “If it stayed with you, it should still
remain the same without you”
/My diary doesn’t have space for love
anymore/
Its so often I think about you, which is
pretty much like remembering my old self,
just because I know myself better with you.
I am still trying to get me back. All the
things you left behind are just pain and
scars that kills me telling you are gone, but
that makes me feel I am alive.
The shoddy garland need not stay, because
you are perfect without its pay.
Writing to you makes me sleep,
as the silence traps all the heat.
Good Night, sleep heavy.
/“Have I written to a dead lover, again?
Okay!! Sounds better than the earlier sweet
one on your proposal”/
